content: I am looking at https://forge.rust-lang.org but can't find guidelines for stable backports (beta backports are here). Where should I look?

namely @Santiago Pastorino I have a question about PR https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/81532

Last week the compiler team declined the stable backport, I have added a comment reflecting this.

I think I didnt remove a specific label because it still appears as candidate for stable nomination. Should the stable-nominated label go away? I cant find another example of rejected stable nomination to learn from

Yeah you can remove the stable-nominated tag from that one. Basically we just decided that as long as the PR was backported to beta in time for the beta promotion, there was no point to doing a stable backport as well since the beta release will be stable by then.
@apiraino :+1:., remember to link to zulip discussions when you do these changes
I saw you were already doing that
but maybe for the stable nomination you could even just link to this topic, so people read what Wesley Wiser have said :)
